intro: Senecio navugabensis, commonly known as the Navugabense Groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers bloom in shades of yellow and are pollinated primarily by insects.
